entries.title: Why would the Chinese government be flying a large stratospheric balloon?
entries.description: It is possible that the balloon's flight termination system failed.

entries.title: Microsoft alleges attacks on French magazine came from Iranian-backed group
entries.description: Leaked personal data of Charlie Hebdo customers puts them at risk from extremists.

entries.title: SEC gets $35 million settlement in Activision misconduct disclosure case
entries.description: Government says company also violated whistleblower protection laws.

entries.title: Treasury decides Model Y, Lyriq, ID.4, are SUVs after all, not sedans
entries.description: Now it will use the consumer EPA standard and not CAFE to decide.

entries.title: Former Trump official led feds to Telegram group livestreaming child abuse
entries.description: At least 17 charged after authorities gained access to encrypted messages.

entries.title: Samsung Pro SSD reliability questioned as longtime partner shifts to Sabrent
entries.description: Custom PC-builder Puget says it's had issues with the Pro line since the last gen.

entries.title: It sounds like Google will unveil its ChatGPT clone February 8
entries.description: Google wants to use "the power of AI to reimagine how people search."

entries.title: Donkey Kong cheating case rocked by photos of illicit joystick modification
entries.description: Tall, red-topped stick could prove crucial in Mitchell's defamation suit.

entries.title: Electrify America is raising its prices in March
entries.description: Rising electricity costs means the base per-kWh price will increase by 5 cents.

entries.title: The newest feature in the Microsoft Store is more ads
entries.description: App store ads on other platforms may offer benefits to devs—but few for users.

entries.title: When will United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan rocket fly?
entries.description: The Peregrine lander is ready for launch. Sort of.

entries.title: Ford will return to F1 in 2026 as an engine builder
entries.description: The automaker has signed a deal with Red Bull Racing.

entries.title: Deep Rock Galactic celebrates 5 years by letting players dig like it’s 2018
entries.description: The dystopian dwarven mine-em-up will let us see just how far it has come.

entries.title: Big Tech groups disclose $10 billion in charges from job culls and cost cuts
entries.description: Amazon, Meta, Alphabet, and Microsoft reveal hefty pricetag as they rein in spending.

entries.title: Until further notice, think twice before using Google to download software
entries.description: Over the past month, Google has been outgunned by malvertisers with new tricks.

entries.title: Acura and Cadillac shine, BMW and Porsche falter at the Rolex 24
entries.description: The new prototypes put on a good show for a packed crowd at the 24-hour race.

entries.title: Rocket Report: Tearing down Ariane’s SUSIE concept; is ChatGPT a rocket scientist?
entries.description: "If you have someone who is worried, don't slough it off. Deal with it."

entries.title: Google isn’t moving Legacy G Suite users again, despite admin console warnings
entries.description: Google accidentally published a bunch of beta messages about last year's transition.

entries.title: Apple Q1 earnings miss the mark almost across the board
entries.description: CEO Tim Cook believes supply issues and a troubled economy were to blame.
